entry.title: Drivechain RfD -- Follow Up
entry.summary: The email exchange between Greg Slepak and Paul Sztorc discusses the Drivechain project and its comparison with P2SH. Paul breaks down Drivechain into four modes: [DC#0], [DC#1], [DC#2], and [DC#3]. Greg raises concerns about the possibility of miners stealing funds in Drivechain, which Paul refutes by explaining that miners cannot steal funds due to an automatic enforcement policy present in all full nodes. However, he acknowledges that users can choose to place their BTC at the mercy of miners in creative ways, similar to P2SH. The discussion also covers the difference between invalid transactions and withdrawals, and the significance of soft fork rules being followed. Overall, the email exchange provides insight into the technical details of the Drivechain project and its potential implications.
